ds_strings_archive.string: Need HM-Cut!
Need HM-Strength!
Need HM-Waterfall!
Need HM-Dive!

[$8632] / +50%[$12948] / +75%[$15106] / +100%[$17264]
 
Yeeeeooow!
Time to play with FIRE!!
I'm the strongest of us brothers!

[ON COOLDOWN / 18 Hours]
[$8632] / +50%[$12948] / +75%[$15106] / +100%[$17264]
 
Chili: Oh! It's you!
Your fire is more intense than when you got the Trio Badge!

[$8632] / +50%[$12948] / +75%[$15106] / +100%[$17264]
 
What incredible luck for you--you get to
battle the best among the three of us.

[ON COOLDOWN / 18 Hours]
[$8632] / +50%[$12948] / +75%[$15106] / +100%[$17264]
 
Cilan: In the Unova region, um, we are still novice Gym Leaders.
Which means, well, that other Gym Leaders are much stronger
than we are. Going...slow...and steady...is OK, so... we compete
with one another and get, um, stronger and stronger.

[$8632] / +50%[$12948] / +75%[$15106] / +100%[$17264]
 
So, um, if you're OK with me, I'll, um, put everything
I've got into being, er, you know, your opponent.

[ON COOLDOWN / 18 Hours]
[$8632] / +50%[$12948] / +75%[$15106] / +100%[$17264]
 
Cress: ...We heard about the incident with N's Castle. If we
had received the message in time, the three of us could
have helped.

[$8736] / +50%[$13104] / +75%[$15288] / +100%[$17472]
 
Welcome! The director of the Nacrene Museum and the
Nacrene Gym's Leader is me! Lenora! Well then, challenger,
I'm going to research how you battle with the Pokémon
you've so lovingly raised!

[ON COOLDOWN / 18 Hours]
[$8736] / +50%[$13104] / +75%[$15288] / +100%[$17472]
 
Lenora: Oh, it's you! As always, you're raising your Pokémon
with a lot of love! By the way, ol' Clay contacted me recently.
He said you can find Pokémon Fossils in Twist Mountain!
Go check it out if you like!

[$8840] / +50%[$13260] / +75%[$15470] / +100%[$17680]
 
Thanks again for your help. My bug Pokémon are scurrying with
excitement about getting to battle you. Let's get straight to it!

[ON COOLDOWN / 18 Hours]
[$8840] / +50%[$13260] / +75%[$15470] / +100%[$17680]
 
Burgh: Heya! This is what I do.
I keep raising Pokémon and drawing pictures inspired by the
Pokémon I raise. It's what I love to do.
My life hums with energy. What could be better?
Now. Come. On. Step on this switch, and what happens?\nMoi!

[$8944] / +50%[$13416] / +75%[$15652] / +100%[$17888]
 
Did the fantastic speed leave you dizzy? My beloved Pokémon
will be the next one to make your head spin!

[ON COOLDOWN / 18 Hours]
[$8944] / +50%[$13416] / +75%[$15652] / +100%[$17888]
 
Elesa: I think the real me is the one who battles with Pokémon as
a Gym Leader. A model's job is to make someone else's vision
look like a reality. It's interesting, but it's not easy...

[$9048] / +50%[$13572] / +75%[$15834] / +100%[$18096]
 
Well... Think it's about time to see fer myself what it is about yer
skills that made a Gym Leader like Elesa take such a shine to ya.

[ON COOLDOWN / 18 Hours]
[$9048] / +50%[$13572] / +75%[$15834] / +100%[$18096]
 
Clay: Mrrmph! You, huh? Remember what I done told ya? If ya
think ya can go, go wherever, and if ya think ya can do somethin',
keep doin' it. Do things how ya want! Decide yer own limits.

[$9152] / +50%[$13728] / +75%[$16016] / +100%[$18304]
 
Hee-hee! I've been waiting for you.
Did you enjoy flying with the help of the Mistralton Gym cannons?
They're my pride and joy! This time, let's try something else!

[ON COOLDOWN / 18 Hours]
[$9152] / +50%[$13728] / +75%[$16016] / +100%[$18304]
 
Skyla: Are you and your Pokémon well? Our battle together was
so much fun. Now, my Pokémon and I have started training again.
I don't usually let people travel in my cargo plane, but battling
with you was such a blast that I'd make an exception.

[$9256] / +50%[$13884] / +75%[$16198] / +100%[$18512]
 
You appear ready to face a Gym Leader. Then... Bring it!

[ON COOLDOWN / 18 Hours]
[$9256] / +50%[$13884] / +75%[$16198] / +100%[$18512]
 
Brycen: In the past, when I was hurt and depressed, Alder shared
this with me... There is strength in being with other people and
Pokémon. Receiving their support makes you stronger. The
young man named Cheren also seems to understand this now.

[$9360] / +50%[$14040] / +75%[$16380] / +100%[$18720]
 
Hi! I'm Iris, the amazingly strong Gym Leader!
Tell me... What Pokémon are you using? How will you fight?
Ooh, I'm super curious, so let's just get started!

[ON COOLDOWN / 18 Hours]
[$9360] / +50%[$14040] / +75%[$16380] / +100%[$18720]
 
You've been on a journey and seen a lot of the world. I'm like
that, too! I'm from way out in the country. I'm really happy that
I've gotten to meet lots of different people and Pokémon!!

Words are engraved on the statue:
“Four great warriors form this Pokémon League.
To the southwest is one who does not fear the Ghost type.
To the southeast is one who channels the power of the
Fighting type. To the northwest is one who has mastered the
Dark type. To the northeast is one who knows the mind of the
Psychic type. If you can defeat these warriors with your
courage and wisdom, you shall be led to the summit,
where the strongest Champion awaits."

“Eyes brimming with dark flame, this man rejected everything
other than himself in order to bring about one singular justice..."
That's part of a novel I'm writing. I was inspired by the challenger
who was just here, and somehow I got a little sad... Excuse me.
You're a challenger, right? I'm the Elite Four's Ghost-type
Pokémon user, Shauntal, and I shall be your opponent.

“The Trainer's thoughts joined with the Pokémon's mind, and a
lustrous Aqua Ring unfurled..." That's part of a novel I wrote.
I absolutely love writing about the close bonds between the
Trainers who come here and the Pokémon they train. Could I
use you and your Pokémon as a subject?

“‘Do you know Thunderbolt?' was his first greeting to me.
It wasn't until after we battled that I learned his name was Volkner."

That's part of a novel I wrote.

I absolutely love writing about the close
bonds between the Trainers who

come here and the Pokémon they train.

Could I use you and your Pokémon as
a subject?

“The tiny but strong Pokémon looked up at its Trainer and saw
the seeds of doubt taking root as together they faced their
toughest opponent yet. The Pokémon sounded a soft cry of
reassurance, and the battle began..." That was part of a novel
I wrote. I absolutely love writing about the close bonds between
the Trainers who come here and the Pokémon they train.
Could I use you and your Pokémon as a subject?

“This world doesn't exist just for you. And I'll tell you why..."
That was part of a novel I wrote. I absolutely love writing about
the close bonds between the Trainers who come here and the
Pokémon they train. Could I use you and your Pokémon as a
subject?

“I have no idea what day it is today, but I will never forget it
for the rest of my life." That was part of a novel I wrote.
I absolutely love writing about the close bonds between the
Trainers who come here and the Pokémon they train.
Could I use you and your Pokémon as a subject?

S-sorry! First, I must apologize to my Pokémon... I'm really sorry
you had a bad experience because of me! Oh! It's not your fault!
This is how battles always are. Even in light of that, I'm still one
of the Elite Four!

S-sorry! First, I must apologize to my Pokémon... I'm really sorry
you had a bad experience because of me! Oh! It's not your fault!
This is how battles always are. Even in light of that, I'm still one
of the Elite Four!

Every person who works with Pokémon has a Pokémon story to
tell. I've found that stories where people and Pokémon help each
other out are far more interesting than stories about only people,
or only Pokémon!

Every person who works with Pokémon has a Pokémon story to
tell. I've found that stories where people and Pokémon help each
other out are far more interesting than stories about only people,
or only Pokémon!

Challenger, if you defeat the entire Elite Four of the Pokémon
League, you can go on to challenge the Champion. And you
have earned that right. Your story is yours and yours alone.
Please weave a wonderful tale!

Man oh man... What is going on today?Challengers coming one right
after another. Well, no matter. I am Grimsley of the Elite Four, and I will
fulfill my duty to be your opponent.

Life is a serious battle, and you have to use the tools you're given.
It's more important to master the cards you're holding than to
complain about the ones your opponents were dealt. Let us
begin. And may the best Trainer win! Contests like this are
proof that you are really living...

Whether or not you get to fight at full strength, whether or not luck smiles
on you--none of that matters. Only results matter. And a loss is a loss.
See, victory shines like a bright light. And right now, you and your Pokémon
are shining brilliantly.

There are bad ways to win-- and good ways to lose. What's
interesting and troubling is that it's not always clear which
is which. A flipped coin doesn't always land heads or tails.
Sometimes it may never land at all...
Excellent! The nice thing about Pokémon battles is they teach\nthe loser something, as well. That said... You should take that\nstrength and test it against the rest of the Elite Four!

Astonishing! You have defeated every member of the Pokémon
League's Elite Four. But it isn't over yet. There is one more
opponent against whom you must prove your strength. Check
the statue in the central plaza, and continue to the final room.

Who are you? How impudent you are to disturb my sleep. Hmf...
You appear to possess a combination of strength and kindness.
Very well. Make your best effort not to bore me with a
yawn-inducing battle. Clear?

Who's there? Who is so uncouth as to disturb my sleep? Hmf... It's
you again. Still, you possess that combination of kindness and
strength. Yet you seem stronger than before... Do be sure not to
bore me with a snooze-inducing battle, is that clear?
You haven't faced all of the members of the Elite Four yet, have you?\nDon't concern yourself about me. Go on ahead.
Alas! Even with the knowledge and skill passed down in my\nfamily of Trainers, I still can't win. The reason I came\nhere in the first place was to encounter Trainers like you...

In the past, when I battled, the force of my emotions shook me greatly.
When my power awoke, I came close to destroying everything around me.
That weak person no longer exists... Still, sometimes, my determination fails.
Always, I aspire to wrap up a victory with elegance and grace. I invite you
to be my opponent again in the future, if you wish.

In the past, my untrained heart made my power run wild.
I was forbidden to battle. All I craved then was to experience
the pure excitement of battling like this. Hee hee...
Although I'm embarrassed, I can't help smiling right now.

You have defeated the Pokémon League's Elite Four.
You have earned the right to proceed to the Champion's room.
Making an entrance is not the point. Once you're there, you'll
need to unleash your power to the fullest!

Greetings, challenger. My name is Marshal.
In order to master the art of fighting, I'm training under my mentor,
Alder. My mentor sees your potential as a Trainer and is taking an
interest in you. It is my intention to test you--to take you to the
limits of your strength. Kiai!

I thank you deeply for the chance for another round of combat
against you. In myself, I seek to develop the strength of a fighter.
And shatter any weakness in myself! Prevailing with the force of
my convictions! Victory, decisive victory, is my intention!
Challenger, here I come!
There are still many strong Trainersin this Pokémon League.\nYou should deepen your bonds with your Pokémon by battling with them.

In times past, I wandered all the regions of the world in pursuit
of strength... One day, I met my mentor and began to grasp the
wisdom of making strength an internal quality... And one day,
I decided to become part of the Elite Four of Unova... For some
reason, the battle we just had brought those fateful times
back to mind.

Now... You have become the strongest Trainer in this Pokémon League.
The statue in the central chamber will take you to the Champion's room.
We, the Elite Four of Unova, are sworn to follow the Champion's order
to be neutral. So the rest is up to you!
The strength shown by you and your Pokémon has deeply\nimpressed me... Please, continue to the next room to face\nthe strongest Trainer of the Unova region!

Alder: I am grateful for what you did about N. I don't
know what he's thinking now, but I'm sure he realizes that
different people and Pokémon have their own paths to follow.
Say now, how about a match with the strongest Trainer in the Unova region?

Alder: I've really been looking forward
to deciding who's the strongest
Pokémon Trainer in the Unova region! Kiai!

Alder: Well done! You certainly are an unmatched talent!
Come with me!

Alder: This room is the Hall of Fame. It exists to commemorate
the Trainers and Pokémon who have demonstrated their stellar
strength and kindness of heart.

Alder: No matter how many times I visit,
I always feel a little awed by the names engraved here.
Well, now, {00}.\n\n
Well, now, {00}.\n\n

With your skill and persistence, you have earned your place
in this Hall of Fame. Your name, the account of your journey,
and the history of your battles will all be recorded here.
I hope all of this becomes a support to you and helps you
grow stronger. Now, Trainer, you and the Pokémon who
fought by your side will be recorded in this machine!
???: What's this?\n\n

What an uncanny resemblance... It's surprising to meet another
Trainer who has intense eyes like that Pokémon Trainer.
What's your name? ... OK. I'll remember that! {00},
nice to meet you. I'm Cynthia. I'm a Pokémon Trainer,
too, like you. I have an insatiable curiosity for
researching Pokémon myths.

I'm sure you know about Undella Town's Abyssal Ruins, right?
I'm staying here at my friend's villa so I can investigate them.
In order to get to know each other better as Pokémon Trainers,\nI would like our Pokémon to have a match.\nWould you care to be my opponent?

Before I send out my Pokémon, my heart always begins to race...
Interesting... My Pokémon in their Poké Balls are radiating a
happy feeling. Are you the reason? What are you?
Ha ha. You prefer to take things slowly and rationally,\nam I right? When you're ready, come and talk to me.\nI'll be happy to see you.
Cynthia: Oh. You've had a chance to get ready?\nI do want our Pokémon to have a match...\nAre you prepared to be my opponent?

Cynthia: That was beyond my expectation! What an exceptional
battle! You certainly bear a resemblance to that Trainer
who faced Giratina... Oh, pardon me. I was just thinking
out loud. I love being here in spring and summer.
I can't stay all year, because there's so much to investigate
in Sinnoh, as well. You're a great Trainer, and it would make
me happy to see you again sometime.

Cynthia: I love to come here in spring and summer.
But there are a lot of things to investigate in Sinnoh, as well.
I'd be delighted to see you again.
You're an awesome Pokémon Trainer!

[$16560] / +50%[$24840] / +75%[$28980] / +100%[$33120]
 
Cynthia: How terrific to see you again! I've got to tell you...
My Pokémon are excited to battle yours.
Would you care to be my opponent?
Cynthia: This will be such fun! No holds barred!\n\n

Cynthia: As our Pokémon meet in battle, I'll learn more
about you and how you've taken care of them.
Cynthia: Oh, what a pity. Summers in Undella Town make me\nfeel like I'm on holiday. I forget about battling! But in spring,\nI feel like getting worked up with a good battle.
Cynthia: I'm a little disappointed.I know you can battle on bigger\nstages than you've done so far! It's so plain to me that your light\ncan shine brighter than this...

[ON COOLDOWN / 18 Hours]
[$16560] / +50%[$24840] / +75%[$28980] / +100%[$33120]
 
Cynthia: When you meet Trainers, battle them to learn about the
kind of people they are. Observe the Pokémon they choose, which
moves they taught them, and which items the Pokémon hold.
You don't need words at such times...
If you want to know more about me...
Come to Sinnoh!

[ON COOLDOWN / 18 Hours]
[$16560] / +50%[$24840] / +75%[$28980] / +100%[$33120]
 
Cynthia: For some reason, this reminds me of a time when
I told a Trainer like you to go see many, many more places
and to meet many more Pokémon. For me, it has really
been worthwhile to come all the way to far Unova. Why?
Because... I met you, and my world got wider!

[$15660] / +50%[$23490] / +75%[27405] / +100%[31320]
 
Oh! You've become strong! I can tell.
Do you want to have a battle with me?
Well, let's begin!\n\n
No? I've been raising Pokémon, thinking about their Abilities\nand just the right combination of held items. What a pity...\n

[ON COOLDOWN / 18 Hours]
[$15660] / +50%[$23490] / +75%[27405] / +100%[31320]
 
You think about battles very thoroughly.
I lost, but I learned a lot from you.
Besides, it was fun! Come back again tomorrow.

Gen 6 When?
WOW, SupersStrings is awesome!

Hey guys, did you know that in terms of human companionship, Flareon is objectively the most huggable Pokemon? While their maximum temperature is likely too much for most, they are capable of controlling it, so they can set themselves to the perfect temperature for you. Along with that, they have a lot of fluff, making them undeniably incredibly soft to touch. But that's not all, they have a very respectable special defense stat of 110, which means that they are likely very calm and resistant to emotional damage. Because of this, if you have a bad day, you can vent to it while hugging it, and it won't mind. It can make itself even more endearing with moves like Charm and Baby Doll Eyes, ensuring that you never have a prolonged bout of depression ever again.
I Masterballed an Alpha
Can someone give me a Pokemon?
